intro: Dichoropetalum alanyensis, commonly known as the Alanyan dichoropetalum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique bilateral symmetry in its floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it produces showy, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
